statement.p:
Suppose a statistics software returns the following:
Point estimate for \beta_1: {{B1}}.
Point estimate for \beta_0: {{B0}}.
Standard Error for \beta_1: {{S1}}.
t-score for \beta_1: {{tscore}}.
95% Confidence Interval for \beta_1: [{{LB}}, {{UB}}].
p-value for H_0:\beta_1=0, H_A: \beta_1\neq 0: p-value={{pvalue}}.

ol.li: Interpret what this Confidence Interval means in the context of this problem.
Interpret what p-value means in the context of this problem.
What do we conclude from this hypothesis test? Why?
The slope of the regression line has a 95\% chance of of falling in [{{LB}}, {{UB}}].
